The same error does not occur with Axis2 v1.2.

Created an attachment (id=81574)
Fix for the Axis2 1.3 mex issue

Its again a filtering problem, added the mex-impl to the include list to look up for the jar to add it to the axis2 runtime. In the case of the 1.2 it will work default since there is no valid jar exits as mex-impl in the distribution. 
Thanks 
Lahiru

and does not seems to have any issue. Please tell me what I am missing to reproduce the issue?

As a side note the class that missing is in the mail-*jar in the axis2 libs which we have filtered out and not included in the jar include list.

sandakith@sandakith-laptop:~/temp/latest_releases/axis2-1.3/lib$ find . -name '*.jar' -exec grep MessagingException {} \; -print 
Binary file ./mail-1.4.jar matches
./mail-1.4.jar

Any idea on what can be the issue here..

Hi Lahiru,

You'll see the problem if you run Axis2 bottom-up on Converter.java, specify to generate test case in Axis2 client.  When you run the JUnit, you'll get the error in the server console.

I tried adding "mail" to the list of JARs not copied when installing Axis2 facet and the problem went away.

Both mex-impl and mail JAR have been added to the list.

Change committed to R2_0_maintenance and HEAD as v200710311924.
Verified in WTP 2.0.2 and WTP 3.0 11/01 build.
